Montgomery.</description><source>Entertainment</source><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:49:06 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11915002.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link In the 16th century during the era of the samurai, laws prohibited merchants and others&#160;from showing off their wealth by wearing expensive silk kimonos. Instead, they evaded the law by paying for&#160;elaborate tattoos. But there was a hitch: their tattoos had to remain hidden under their kimonos. Since [&#8230;]</description><source>Entertainment</source><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 00:58:29 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11907590.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Japanese tattoo artists bring their traditional art form to Vancouver" href="http://vancouversun.com/news/local-news/japanese-tattoo-artists-bring-their-traditional-art-form-to-vancouver" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11907084</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/local+arts/your+band+finally+gotten+together+what/11907084/story.html</link><title>The Garage: Your band has finally gotten its act together.
